wikipedia_page.main: William Jolly Duncan FRS (1894–1960) was a 20th century Scottish physicist remembered as a pioneer of aeroelasticity and "air flutter" theory critical to modern aviation.

response: * Prof William Jolly Duncan FRS, pioneer researcher in aero-elasticity and air flutter

Prior to his political career, Duncan worked for Ross & Duncan engineers and boilermakers. He and his wife Mary Ann Jolly (1865–1929) had one son, the physicist William Jolly Duncan, and two daughters.

link_mentions.page: List of fellows of the Royal Society D, E, F

response: * William Jolly Duncan, Mechan Professor of Aeronautics and Fluid Mechanics, University of Glasgow
